componentInstanceProperties.name: IntroText
componentInstanceProperties.value: Invest in simple, frictionless Co2 measurement and reduction solutions

componentInstanceProperties.name: summaryText
componentInstanceProperties.value: Be a part of a greener future

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Key Investment Highlights

  • Backed by Visa and $4M Lead Investment: A distribution agreement with Visa has led to signing 3 banks, including top-tier Malaysian bank Maybank and 25 banks in their pipeline. Lead investors Salter Brothers and Perennial have invested $4,000,000 in this round.
  • 110% YoY Growth for FY24: Verrency's current Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) for FY23 is $1.15 million, with a projected FY24 budget of $2.4 million, signifying 110% YoY growth.
  • $250B Market Opportunity: The global voluntary carbon market is projected to reach $250 billion by 2050, with a 17%+ CAGR.* Verrency estimates the addressable market today at $4 billion and aims for an initial market share of approximately 2%, translating to an ARR of around $80 million.
  • Seasoned Leadership: Jeroen van Son is a highly experienced entrepreneur and digital payments executive with over 25 years in global financial services and digital payments, including senior roles with Westpac, Mastercard, Paypal, and Virgin.
  • Strong Intellectual Property: Verrency holds a valuable portfolio of patents, patent applications, trademarks, copyrights, proprietary processes, relationships, and know-how, and is EY quality assured, providing a solid foundation for innovation and growth.

*source: morganstanley.com

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Overview - What is Verrency?

Approx. 70% of consumers expect banks to provide eco-friendly payment solutions. Verrency educates consumers about their consumption carbon footprint and provides easy ways to offset that Co2 pollution footprint, all fully integrated into the way they pay for goods and services with their cards and digital wallets.

Integrated seamlessly into banks' digital payment flows, Verrency ensures a frictionless consumer experience and offers banks a viable and simple way to adopt voluntary carbon reduction initiatives that are good for people and our planet.

Quality assured by EY and with significant IP including patents and trademarks under their belt, Verrency provides access to local carbon offset projects as well as other sustainability initiatives, and the team’s years of experience in banking enables them to strategise with clients to enhance portfolio profitability as well.

With funding from this round, Verrency will scale its Co2 solution globally, primarily investing in sales, marketing, product development and customer success resources aligned with revenue growth for healthy EBITDA growth.

Verrency's unique position at the intersection of the sustainable FinTech market and ClimateTech makes it an enticing opportunity for wholesale impact investors.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
IntroText
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Verrency is raising a round of Series A equity, enabling you to own shares in this company.
This investment opportunity is open to wholesale and pre-approved investors, and you can invest from $5000.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Problem & Market

Consumers contribute to 60-70% of greenhouse gas emissions yet do not have any easy, intuitive way to understand their carbon footprint nor do they have easy ways to offset their pollution and live a Co2-neutral life.

Addressable Market
Morgan Stanley estimates the global voluntary carbon market to grow to US$250 billion by 2050 (17+% Compound Annual Growth). Verrency estimates the addressable market for consumers (measured by the number of banks and their customers) to be US$4bn. They conservatively estimate their near term market-share at ~2%, which corresponds with ~$80m ARR.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
The Verrency Solution

Verrency has developed a solution that educates consumers about their carbon footprint and provides easy and seamless ways to offset their Co2 footprint while at the same time providing banks with a way to boost their rewards and incentives programs and meet their own emissions targets. The company’s solution seamlessly embeds into banks’ digital payments flow, creating a frictionless customer experience. Verrency’s distribution agreement with Visa for Asia Pacific and Central Europe, Middle East & Africa enables massive scale by giving access to a global audience in a highly efficient and cost-effective manner.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Traction

Verrency’s commitment to compliance and risk management makes it an attractive choice for banking clients. Recently winning the ESG Payments Initiative Excellence Award for 2023, the company has a strong global presence in the financial services sector which has allowed it to also integrate into banks' rewards programs and merchant cash-back schemes. As a partner in Visa’s Eco Bundle suite of sustainable products in APAC and CEMEA, Verrency has already signed 3 banks, including top-tier Malaysian bank Maybank, with 25 banks in its constantly growing pipeline. Currently, the company makes $1.15 million ARR with an anticipated 110% YoY growth.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value: Verrency: A Recognised Leader in Payments Innovation

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Competitive Advantage

Verrency’s pedigree is in banking and financial services. The company builds its solutions for 100% compliance with best practice risk management and privacy practices in mind, key buying factors for any prospective banking client. The team’s experience in banking also enables them to credibly strategise with clients on how their services can contribute to portfolio profitability.

The company’s Co2 solution has been quality assured by EY and it provides access to local market Co2 projects. It also provides additional layers of quality control over the Co2 projects it presents to banking clients. Besides Co2 projects, Verrency also provides other sustainability initiatives that consumers can contribute to so banks still hesitating to enter the voluntary Co2 markets with a consumer value proposition can continue engaging with non-Co2 credit issuing sustainability initiatives.

Lastly, the team’s experience in global financial services enables Verrency to integrate into a bank’s rewards and loyalty programs, merchant cash-back programs and other sources of funding for a consumer to pay for the Co2 credits. This removes further friction and pain points for consumer adoption.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Intellectual Property

Verrency holds many patents and patent applications across multiple global jurisdictions.

They also hold registered trademarks over the name Verrency, the domain name www.verrency.com, copyright over the code that underpins the Co2 service, as well as proprietary processes, relationships and know-how which are protected as trade secrets.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Growth Strategy

Funds will be used to scale their Co2 solution globally. For this, they plan to invest in sales, marketing, product and customer success resources. The timing of hiring will be consistent with revenue growth to ensure healthy EBITDA growth.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Exit Strategy

Verrency’s valuation is based on a multiple of 3.6x their budget FY24 ARR (or 6.9x FY23 ARR), comparable to similar companies in their sector.

Within 4 years, Verrency forecasts the business will generate gross annual recurring revenue of $8.8m fueled by the growth of Verrency’s Technology for Good products to dozens of banks with expansion into Australia, APAC, CEMEA, Europe, Africa and USA.

At that stage, the company anticipates investors in this round will be able to exit this investment via:

  • merger with another global sustainability company
  • trade sale to a company like Visa or FIS or another payment FinTech
  • public listing on the ASX, or
  • growth capital round, which would facilitate a sale of existing shareholders’ interests to a larger institutional investor who wishes to grow the business before pursuing a merger, acquisition or IPO

componentInstanceProperties.value:
Why Invest Through VentureCrowd?

VentureCrowd is the leading digital investment platform for alternative assets. We’re here to prove investments can be accessible and impactful. With rigorous curation and due diligence as our backbone, our success track record speaks for itself:

  • Only digital investment platform in Australia to have successfully delivered multiple exit returns to investors through equity crowdfunding

  • 74K+ members and counting

  • 30M+ distributed to investors, and

  • Over $312,000,000 in capital raised since inception

VentureCrowd is investor-led, so we only list deals with secured external lead investors. Our investors then invest on the same economic terms as professional investors. If you invest in one of our deals, you will receive equity or ownership in the company that is raising the capital. Not only might your investment come with lower fees and capital commitments, but it will also come with reduced deal complexity, and you’ll have access to alternative equity, property and credit opportunities on the same terms as professional lead investors.

Invest now

If you would prefer to speak to one of our team members about this offer, please:

  • Book a call or

  • call us on 1300 039 655

Please note, the Fund Manager reserves the right to vary or cancel the Offer, vary the amount raised under the Offer, vary or waive the Minimum Investment and close the Offer, without notice and without giving reasons.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Fees

Investors invest through a VentureCrowd Trust, which VentureCrowd manages as a single asset. We charge an annual management fee to investors, payable on exit and we only charge a performance fee where an exit delivers profit, thereby aligning ourselves with investor outcomes.

  • Contribution Fee: 1.1% This is the fee charged by the Trustee for the establishment of the Trust and the purchasing entity, structuring the overall investment and raising capital by way of issue of Units. Payable upon acceptance of your investment by the Trustee.
  • Management Fee: 1.65% per annum (charged on conversion or exit).
  • Performance Fee: 20% of the profit. We only charge a performance fee on conversion or exit.
